intro: Leptolobium nitidulum, commonly known as the smooth-leaved leptolobium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
